source.7d9a478b:
#South Georgia remains free from Covid-19.

GSGSSI have implemented strict procedures to minimise the risk of exposure to staff at South Georgia, and work continues in as normal a fashion as possible on the island. The tourist season is now complete and Grytviken will remain closed to visitors until at least August 2020. The wharf development continues with works entering the final phase, and preparations for the upcoming fishing season are continuing.

Staff based in the UK and the Falkland Islands are following the advice given by those countries. Therefore all office staff are now working from home, and traveling only when essential.

They wish all their partners, stakeholders, colleagues, friends and family the very best at this difficult and worrying time. If there are things you think they can do right now to further reduce anxiety or concern please let them know.  

Work will continue as best it can but it may be that you will get a slower response than you might have come to expect. They ask for your understanding as they adapt to the current global situation. https://www.gov.gs/gsgssi-covid-19-update/
source.6f856d51:
#In a Pandemic, No man is an Island.

The phrase 'no man is an island' expresses the idea that human beings do badly when isolated from others and need to be part of a community in order to thrive.

John Donne, who wrote the work that the phrase comes from.

No man is an island entire of itself, Every man is a piece of the continent, A part of the main.https://www.phrases.org.uk/meanings/no-man-is-an-island.html[](http://)
source.383f238f:
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands (SGSSI) is a British Overseas Territory in the southern Atlantic Ocean. It is a remote and inhospitable collection of islands, consisting of South Georgia and a chain of smaller islands known as the South Sandwich Islands.

The United Kingdom claimed sovereignty over South Georgia in 1775 and the South Sandwich Islands in 1908. The territory of "South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands" was formed in 1985. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Georgia_and_the_South_Sandwich_Islands

source.18428eeb:
#“The death of any man reduces me, because I am humanity”. 

By By Natalia Pasternak, 08/15/2020.

The pandemic brings out our inability to see ourselves as part of the whole. The only way to effectively combat Covid-19 is to understand it as a disease of society, much more than of the individual.

And in society, no man - no one - is an island. And no collectivity, either: no family, social or economic sector exists in a bubble, without contact with others. When discussing the resumption of certain activities, it is necessary to keep in mind their articulation with the whole. What happens in pubs affects schools, which in turn affect football games. Interrupting transmission depends much less on isolated measures within each sector, such as rules of behavior for children and athletes, and much more on life outside.

For a restaurant to work, employees need to get to work and leave their children with someone, somewhere (school? Daycare? Brother-in-law?). Soccer players can be tested frequently, but they return home and contaminate their family members. One of them may have children who are schoolmates of the waiter's children. Another, living with a brother who likes to stroll in the mall. The employee who works at a school can become contaminated in the work environment, and, on returning home, on the subway, contaminate other people. To interrupt community transmission, it is necessary to go beyond the navel itself.

For every person who can choose whether to stay at home or go to the mall, there are countless who have no option. If the mall is open, that means that store clerks, managers, security guards and cleaning employees will be forced out of social isolation and using public transport. And for every person who thinks their children will be safe because the school is taking all precautions, there are teachers and staff who have no choice but to expose themselves to come and go as well, and have contact with children whose parents, fool around, went to the mall. These teachers can take the virus home.https://translate.google.com.br/translate?hl=en&sl=pt&u=https://blogs.oglobo.globo.com/a-hora-da-ciencia/post/na-pandemia-nenhum-homem-e-uma-ilha.html&prev=search&pto=aue
source.8363cef0:
#Modern society is a highly interconnected ecosystem. The other is not the problem, but the solution.

To believe that we can treat sectors and activities as watertight units, safe in themselves, is to believe that every man is an island. We need to understand that the other is not the problem, but the solution, and that the only way to open pubs, shopping malls and schools, and watch the football championship on the weekend, is to operate together to decrease the community transmission fee.

When we can really function as a society, and understand that our actions have the potential to put the other in danger (or safety), And that it returns to us, then we may be able to control the pandemic.  https://translate.google.com.br/translate?hl=en&sl=pt&u=https://blogs.oglobo.globo.com/a-hora-da-ciencia/post/na-pandemia-nenhum-homem-e-uma-ilha.html&prev=search&pto=aue
